meanings.definition: Resembling a silkworm in appearance or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The soft, bombycoid creature slowly spun its cocoon.
meanings.sent2: The bombycoid caterpillar inched along the branch.
meanings.sent3: The bombycoid bug wore a tiny silk top hat.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, smooth and bombycoid, flowed like silk in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The bombycoid wings of the moth shimmered in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the family Bombycidae.
meanings.sent1: The bombycoid species of moth is known for its silk production.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bombycoid insects to learn more about their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The bombycoid family reunion included all the silk-producing relatives.
meanings.sent4: The bombycoid lineage has been breeding silk moths for generations.
meanings.sent5: The bombycoid characteristics of the silkworm are fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a silkworm.
meanings.sent1: Her gentle and bombycoid nature made her a great listener.
meanings.sent2: The bombycoid texture of the fabric resembled silk.
meanings.sent3: The bombycoid behavior of the child mimicked that of a silkworm.
meanings.sent4: His words were as smooth and bombycoid as silk threads.
meanings.sent5: The bombycoid movements of the dancer were graceful and fluid.
